TableField.name: InjurySourceDesc
TableField.phrase: Source Description|A detailed description of the source of the injury and/or illness
TableField.sample: Mr. Thorslund was operating the drilling machine in the Maintenance Department when he drilled through his finger. The guide on the drilling machine had been removed.

TableField.name: InjuryObject
TableField.phrase: Object|A short phrase used to describe the specific onject causing injury

TableField.name: ObjectDesc
TableField.phrase: Object Description|A detailed description of the the object causing injury or illness and any special characteristics of the object at the time of the incident
TableField.sample: This drill press was out of service when Mr. Thorslund was using it. Mr. Thorslund detached the key fob and lock used to secure power to the drill press during maintenance.

TableField.name: RegulatoryRecordable
TableField.phrase: Recordable?|Whether the injury is recordable based on a regulatory requirement

TableField.name: PrivacyCase
TableField.phrase: Privacy Case?|Whether the injury is a privacy case and should not include the employee name on the record keeping log

CalculatedField.phrase: Injured Person|The name of the injured or ill person

TableField.phrase: Rationale|A detailed description of the rationale for identifying this injury as a regulatory recordable injury

TableField.name: WorkBegan
TableField.phrase: Began Work|The time the person began work on the date the injury or illness occurred

TableField.name: DateofDeath
TableField.phrase: Date of Death|If person died, the date that death occurred

ForeignField.phrase: Injury or Illness Category|Select one of these categories. Categorize the injury by selecting the most serious outcome of the injury

SummaryField.name: ClaimCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Claim Costs|The total estimated amount of the cost to manage and mitigate claims related to this incident

SummaryField.name: RollupCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Rollup Costs|The total estimated amount of the cost to manage and mitigate claims related to this incident

SummaryField.name: LocalCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Local Costs|The estimated amount of costs attached directly to this record

CalculatedField.name: TotalCost
CalculatedField.phrase: Total Cost|The automatically calculated cost associated with this incident. Costs are derived by compiling all claim costs and those costs associated with managing this incident and tracked within the Costs module

RangeField.name: CostSeverityID
RangeField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverity
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

RemoteField.name: CachedTotalCost
RemoteField.phrase: Total Cost|The total cost of this incident

RemoteField.name: CachedSeverityValue
RemoteField.phrase: Cost Severity|The severity this incident

CalculatedField.name: CalculatedSeverityValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Calculated Severity Value|The greater of the User-assigned severity value and the acutomaticlly assigned Cost Severity value

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

ForeignField.name: LikelihoodValue
ForeignField.phrase: Likelihood Value|A numerical value assigned to the likelihood of risk occurrence. The likelihood value is used in combination with the severity value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk

ForeignField.name: RiskLikelihoodTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood Term|A one word description of the risk likelihood level

ForeignField.name: Likelihood
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodStatusID
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

CodeField.name: LikelihoodStatus
CodeField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodFactors
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Factors|A detailed description of the factors affecting the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat
RemoteField.sample: SCBAs were purchased for all First Responders and all responders have been trained by the Fire Department

RemoteField.name: SeverityID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module

ForeignField.name: SeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Severity Value|A numerical value assigned to the severity of risk or loss. The severity value is used in combination with the likelihood value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk of loss

ForeignField.name: RiskSeverityTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity Term|A one word description of the risk severity level

ForeignField.name: Severity
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module
ForeignField.sample: SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00

CalculatedField.name: IndexValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Index Value|A calculated field based on the risk likelihood and risk severity. The resulting risk index value is compared against the assigned risk index recommendations entered into the Risk Index module and the respective recommendation is displayed

RangeField.name: RiskRecommendation
RangeField.phrase: Recommended Action|An automatically assigned recommendation, based on the values assigned for Likelihood and Severity
RangeField.sample: Take action if and when appropriate

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: LossInjury
CombinedField.phrase: Loss Injury|A combined field used to describe this injury loss when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: Jane Doe; Active Agenda, HQ; Packaging Area; 01-01-2004

SampleItem.name: Sugar coating raisins on the sugar shaker, Active Agenda, HQ, Packaging Area
Regulating the vibration on the sugar shaker, Active Agenda, HQ, Packaging Area
Closing the lid on the sugar shaker, Active Agenda, HQ, Packaging Area
raking sugar wtihin the sugar shaker, Active Agenda, HQ, Packaging Area
Contact with Objects and Equipment | Struck Against Object | Stepped on object
Contact with Objects and Equipment | Struck Against Object | Struck against stationary object
Contact with Objects and Equipment | Struck Against Object | Struck against a moving object
LOW: Possible but unlikely to occur
PROBABLE: Very likely to occur in immediate future
SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00
SERIOUS: Serious injury or illness; 9001.00 to 90,000.00
SEVERE: Death or disabling injury; 90,001.00 to 900,000.00
CATASTROPHIC: Deaths and/or disabling injuries; 900,001.00 to 1,000,000.00

EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit summary information about an injury and/or illness loss

EditScreen.phrase: Incident|Edit incident details associated with an injury and/or illness loss

SampleItem.name: LOW: Possible but unlikely to occur
PROBABLE: Very likely to occur in immediate future
SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00
SERIOUS: Serious injury or illness; 9001.00 to 90,000.00
SEVERE: Death or disabling injury; 90,001.00 to 900,000.00
CATASTROPHIC: Deaths and/or disabling injuries; 900,001.00 to 1,000,000.00

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
